job_description: Power Planning Engineer - job post ePace Technologies Taylor, TX 76574 $40 - $50 an hour -  Full-time, Part-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $40 - $50 an hour Job Type Full-time Part-time Contract ROLE : Power Planning Engineer Location : Taylor, TX Client : ERCOT JOB SUMMARY Provides electrical engineering analysis and technical support for the planning and operation of the electric power system. Implements appropriate system modelling, develops tools and procedures to monitor and control the system, performs system studies, analyses simulated or actual operating results, develops solutions to current or future system issues, and appropriately reports findings and recommendations. JOB DUTIES Designs and performs steady-state contingency analyses using power flow models (Power world or PSSE) under the direction of a senior-level engineer or management. Prepares near-term and long-term transmission planning assessments in accordance with NERC Reliability Standards, ERCOT Protocols and Planning Guides. EDUCATION Bachelor's Degree: Engineering or related field (Required) or a combination of education and experience that provides equivalent knowledge to a major in such fields is required EXPERIENCE Minimum 3 years transmission planning experience is required Experience with powerflow software such as Powerworld or PSSE is required Experience with Python programming is preferred Please share your updated resume to vinod(at)epacetech.com Thanks Vinod vinod(at)epacetech.com 929-443-0769, 972-249-4738 Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: electrical engineering: 3 years (Preferred) Planning Engineer: 6 years (Required) power flow software: 6 years (Required) Power world or PSSE: 6 years (Required) Python: 2 years (Preferred) electric power System: 6 years (Required) Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Field Application Engineer, Embedded Solutions - job post Assa Abloy 722 reviews Austin, TX • Remote Part-time Assa Abloy 722 reviews Read what people are saying about working here. You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Field Application Engineer, Embedded Solutions An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Field Application Engineer, Embedded Solutions Location : Remote, US Job ID: 17822 Do you have interest in new technologies? Does supporting clients across a variety of verticals and industries with embedded technology solutions sound interesting? Solving technical issues and advising clients across diverse environments feel motivating? If you are looking for career growth, with a market leader, in progressive, global technology solutions, providing positive impact across the world every day, join us now! Who are we? HID Global powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely. We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,000 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo HID’s Extended Access Technologies (EAT) Business: The EAT business embeds trust into the world’s digital devices using innovative authentication technologies. EAT has a broad portfolio of technology products such as, physical & virtual credentials, digital identity biometrics, or ID document readers. We are a partner ecosystem and develop tools enabling full solutions across both the public and private sectors. This role will join a small, close-knit team, in the RFID business unit, supporting our internal and external business partners in pre-sales activities. As our Field Application Engineer, you’ll support HID’s success by: Representing the company as the technical expert to internal and external customers and partners. Assisting customers in selecting the correct products to best suit their requirements. Supporting the integration of our products into customer applications and systems. Preparing and presenting technical training for customers, partners, and internal staff. Preparing documentation for specialized seminars, application notes, and technical papers. Providing on-site support to customers, (e.g., troubleshooting, training, Q&A, etc.). Providing specialized system conceptualization and configuration services. Providing customer feedback to product management, marketing, and engineering teams. Managing multiple projects (time, resources, monitoring, reporting and documentation). What we will love about your background: Knowledge and/or experience with RFID technologies preferred. Programming and/or scripting experience for embedded applications a plus. Strong communication skills both verbally and written. Proven ability in critical thinking and problem solving. Operating system experience (Windows, Linux, Mac OS X, iOS, Android) desired. Your Experience and Education include: Bachelor’s Degree preferred, Engineering or Computer Science focus is a plus. Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a related field support role highly preferred. Up to 40% travel required, some international. Why ? Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to . Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers. Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted. The wage range for this role considers a broad scope of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At HID, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The base salary in the United States is $108,000 to $155,700. This opportunity may be open to flexible working arrangements. HID Global is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation. Application due 2023-05-25 Function Engineering & Science Experience level Mid-senior level Location Austin, Texas, United States
